metadata.title: CVE-2022-0108 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in Navigation in Google Chrome prior to97.0.4692.71 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0108` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
webkitgtk package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in esm-infra/bionic is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
qtwebkit-source package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
